Name.BusinessNameLine1: THE COMMUNITY FOUNDATION OF SARASOTA CO INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Providing stewardship to our communities, enabling caring people and organizations to increase their ability to serve. For Good. For Ever.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Providing stewardship to our communities, enabling caring people and organizations to increase their ability to serve. For Good. For Ever.
IRS990.Description: GRANTS: THE FOUNDATION GAVE OUT 954 GRANTS TOTALING $7,430,951 TO OVER 419 NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. THESE GRANTS AVERAGED $7,077 AND WERE GIVEN FOR EDUCATION, MENTAL HEALTH, ELDERCARE, ANIMAL WELFARE AND THE ENVIRONMENT AS WELL AS PROVIDING NEEDED PROGRAM SUPPORT FOR LOCAL AGENCIES. The Foundation manages charitable donor funds to ensure the philanthropic and administrative goals of donors and the community are met.

Activity2.Description: SCHOLARSHIPS: THE FOUNDATION AWARDED 278 SCHOLARSHIPS TOTALING $465,064 FROM 43 FUNDS TO NEW AND RETURNING COLLEGE STUDENTS with 103 scholarships in the amount of $180,018 going to non-traditional students. Scholarship funds are established and managed to ensure that the community's educational needs are met.

Activity3.Description: The Nonprofit Resource Center (NRC): The NRC conducted 84 trainings covering nonprofit management, fund development, governance, volunteer management and other topics. Nearly 2,000 attendees representing almost 450 organizations attended these workshops. The NRC also runs an online job bank, in which 209 job openings were posted for local agencies. The NRC's resource library had over 112 reference books checked out during the year and the NRC's database of grantmakers scheduled 93 sessions with local nonprofit staff and volunteers. The NRC also offers over 200 digital resources including links to capacity building websites and articles about nonprofit management.

ActivityOther.Description: BUILDING: THE FOUNDATION OFFERS ITS MEETING AND CONFERENCE ROOMS FREE OF CHARGE TO LOCAL NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. DURING THIS FISCAL YEAR THERE WERE 44 NONPROFIT GROUPS WITH 3,338 INDIVIDUALS THAT USED THE BUILDING FOR 117 STAFF MEETINGS, BOARD RETREATS, workshops, etc.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: TO PROVIDE GRANTS THAT ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF LIFE IN SARASOTA COUNTY AND SURROUNDING AREAS.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: Grantees are required to submit written final reports in a specific format upon completion of the grant or 13 months from the time the grant is awarded, whichever comes first. Exceptions are made for operating grants from donor advised funds.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: The executive committee of the Board of Directors annually reviews and determines the compensation package of the President/CEO

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: Investment accounts are held at major financial institutions with money managers processing and selling stock contributions.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Vice President of Finance & Administration and the President / CEO initally review the return before presenting the return to the audit committee who recommends final approval to the board of directors before filing the return.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Annually the board are required to fill out a conflict of interest questionnaire which is reviewed upon receipt by the President/CEO and again during the audit process.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Executive committee of the Board of Directors annually reviews and determines the compensation package of the President/CEO.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization makes all documents available upon request.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Responsibility of audit oversight and audit firm selection
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Foundation has an audit committee that is charged with oversight of the audit and makes recommendations to the board on selection of audit firms.

THE BOARD MEMBERS ARE NOT PAID AND THEREFORE ARE CONSIDERED VOLUNTEERS OF THE COMMUNITY FOUNDATION. IN ADDITION, THE NON PROFIT RESOURCE CENTER INCLUDES VOLUNTEERS THAT PROVIDE CONSULTING SERVICES WITH NON PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS IN THE COMMUNITY.
